page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY & ARCHAEOLOGY
page.content:
The Standing Stone at Vellacott Lane is probably a boundary stone as it stands on the boundary between Combe Martin and Trentishoe. The stone has been connected with the sheep stealing legend of Hangman Hill.
The Tumulus near Long Lane farm may have been part of the important site on Mattocks Down. In the 17th century this site was recorded as having row of 23 standing stones but by the 18th century the site had been destroyed. Unfortunately this was before a scientific approach to archaeology had been established so its real importance may never be known.
